page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION.
page.content: The area is mainly agricultural and predominantly arable,with the chief crops being wheat,barley and potatoes.Vegetables which can be sold locally and from farm shops form the majority of the remaining crops.The largest settlement is the village of Orsett.This is now a residential dormitory for the Grays area.It is also the site of the Orsett General Hospital which serves Thurrock.It also has its own school,post office,shop and village hall. The Orsett Cock,a public house and road junction which has caused considerable hold ups in the past now enjoys peace and quiet as the new extension of the A13 opened 27th June 1985 passes underneath the roundabout and runs on eastwards to Stanford-le- Hope.In the southern part of the area are a number of gravel pits.
